I use several methods to DRM-free my books. The first method is ripping software (I have four different programs that I use). I also use Acrobat 11 Pro, Calibre and Sigil.

The second method involves intercepting the source material. The third is involves retail rips. That's what I did with yours. I found a good consumer version and stRipped it.

The other copies out there sucked. That one with the huge red watermark was a nightmare. I worked on that one for hours and couldn't tear all the content out. It acted like an embedded graphic in some places but in other areas, I could strip the URL and links. Weird.

So here's the final product. It's my least favored way of retrieving titles, but after a little while, I felt your frustration and went for it. And it worked.
